Package se.itu.hunt

Contains the classes for this small example game. The game was inspired by a C programming exercise by Joachim von Hacht:
Hunt - A simple silly game.

It was ported to Java by Rikard.

C programming language version here: sillyhunt.c(chalmers.se).

The objective of the game is to move around on a board and try to find a hidden treasure (randomly put at one coordinate of the board).

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    GameUI
    An interface representing a display of a board.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Avatar
    Represents the player character in the game.
    Board
    Represents a board for the game, with a treasure at a random Position.
    Dimension  
    GUIGame
    An implementation of a FieldDisplay for GUI-based interface.
    MainGUI  
    MainTextGame
    Hunt - A simple silly game Ported to Java by Rikard, Original author of the C version: hajo C programming language version here: http://www.cse.chalmers.se/edu/year/2009/course/LEU480/lect/ch5/sillyhunt.c
    Position
    Represents a Position on a Board in this game.
    TablePosition
    Represents an immutable Position to be used in a JTable.
    TestGame
    Hunt - A simple silly game Ported to Java by Rikard, Original author of the C version: hajo C programming language version here: http://www.cse.chalmers.se/edu/year/2009/course/LEU480/lect/ch5/sillyhunt.c
    TextGame
    An implementaion of a GameUI for a text-based interface.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Direction
    Represents a Direction in the range: NORTH SOUTN EAST WEST
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    IllegalMoveException
    Represents the Exception for when an Avatar tries to move in a direction outside of the Board.
